title: How to Make a Tazer from a Disposable Camera

steps.headline: Open up the disposable camera.
steps.description: There should be a paper or sticker wrapping around it so you might want to get it off first

steps.headline: Take the battery out.
steps.description: You don't want to shock yourself.

steps.headline: Take out any non-electrical parts.
steps.description: You might want to keep the film so you don't lose your precious memories.

steps.headline: Take two strips of metal.
steps.description: You're going to need metal that is highly conductive.

steps.headline: Wrap the end of the metal strips to the wires leading up to the transformer.
steps.description: The transformer is the black battery looking cylinder.

steps.headline: Put the battery in carefully.
steps.description: Make sure you don't shock yourself.

steps.headline: Test it on a piece of metal.

text: Get a disposable camera. They're about 5 bucks at Walmart. Open up the disposable camera. There should be a paper or sticker wrapping around it so you might want to get it off first Take the battery out. You don't want to shock yourself. Take out any non-electrical parts. You might want to keep the film so you don't lose your precious memories. Take two strips of metal. You're going to need metal that is highly conductive. Wrap the end of the metal strips to the wires leading up to the transformer. The transformer is the black battery looking cylinder. Put the battery in carefully. Make sure you don't shock yourself. Turn it on.  Test it on a piece of metal.
